data.title: Cary Middlecoff (Golfer)
data.meta_description: Profile of golfer Cary Middlecoff with biographical facts, historical events and Cary Middlecoff's married life.
data.text:
Cary Middlecoff

Profession: Golfer

Biography: Won the US Open in 1949 and 1956 and the US Masters in 1955.

Born: January 6, 1921

Birthplace: Halls, Tennessee, USA

Generation: Greatest Generation

Chinese Zodiac: Monkey

Star Sign: Capricorn

Died: September 1, 1998 (aged 77)

Historical Events

12th US Masters Tournament, Augusta National GC: Claude Harmon shoots a record-tying 279 (âˆ’9) to finish 5 strokes ahead of runner-up Cary Middlecoff

US Open Men's Golf, Medinah CC: Cary Middlecoff wins the first of his 2 Open titles, 1 stroke ahead of Clayton Heafner and Sam Snead

19th US Masters Tournament, Augusta National GC: Cary Middlecoff wins by a record 7 strokes ahead of Ben Hogan

PGA Championship Men's Golf, Meadowbrook CC: Doug Ford scores a 4 & 3 win over Cary Middlecoff in the Tuesday final; first of 2 majors (Masters 1957)

US Open Men's Golf, Oak Hill CC: Cary Middlecoff wins his second Open title, 1 stroke ahead of runners-up Julius Boros and Ben Hogan

US Open Men's Golf, Inverness Club: Dick Mayer defeats defending champion Cary Middlecoff by 7 strokes in an 18-hole playoff to win his only major title

23rd US Masters Tournament, Augusta National GC: Art Wall Jr wins by 1 stroke from Cary Middlecoff for his only PGA Tour major victory

Famous Golfers

Ernie Els

Gene Littler

Jordan Spieth

Leo Diegel

Sally Little

Wayne Grady
